item.description:
Please join us on a hike to Arethusa Falls, the highest waterfall in NH!  This is a moderate hike, with an elevation gain of 1,200 feet.

Between Arethusa Falls and Ripley Falls stands Frankenstein Cliff, named for the famous artist Godfrey Frankenstein.  The Frankenstein Cliff Trail affords excellent views of Crawford Notch and Mt. Willey (4285 ft.)  The trail is often steep and gravelly, so please wear good hiking shoes. 

We plan to climb the Frankenstein cliff trail first and then loop down the easier, Arethusa-Ripley Falls Trail on the way back.  The 5 mile hike may take 4 hours or so, depending upon the length of our breaks.  Please bring a lunch and plenty of water.

 

Hiking Route:

Begin at Upper Parking Lot:                               (1240')

Outlook from Frankenstein Cliff:                        (2150')  (1.5 miles)

Jct. Frankenstein Cliff Trail / Falcon Cliff Trail (2300')  (0.6 miles)

Jct. Arethusa-Ripley Falls Trail / Frankenstein Cliff Trail (2420')  (1.3 miles)

Arethusa Falls                                                       (2000')

Return to Upper Parking Lot:                               (1240')  (1.6 miles)

 

Driving Directions:

The Arethusa Falls and Frankenstein Cliff trailheads are within Crawford Notch State Park. They are located in Harts Location, New Hampshire, on a spur road, signed for Arethusa Falls, off of Rt. 302.

Driving Directions Coming from the west:

  • The side road is about 14.4 miles east of the junction of Rt. 3 and Rt. 302. It's also about 9.3 miles east of the Mount Washington Hotel.
  • Turn right onto the side road.
  • The lower parking lot will be on your right; Continue to the upper parking lot.


Driving Directions Coming from the east:

  • The side road is about 14.5 miles west of the junction of Rt. 16 and Rt. 302. It's also about 8.5 miles west of Bear Notch Road which is on the left-hand side of Rt. 302 in Bartlett.
  • Turn left onto the side road.
  • The lower parking lot will be on your right; Continue to the upper parking lot.

 

Trailhead: Route 302 in Crawford Notch a few miles west of the Sawyer Rock Picnic area, 3.4 miles south of the Willey House site in Crawford Notch State Park.  Please park at the upper parking lot.  (Latitude:44.14753 Longitude:-71.37014)

Please call me with any questions, 603-312-6735.  Thanks
item.how_to_find_us: ~14.5 miles from junction of Rt 16 & Rt 302 or 14.4 miles from junction of Rt 3 & Rt 302, Crawford Notch State Park

group.name: Trailblazers- A Seacoast Singles Meetup Group

item.name: Arethusa Falls Hike, New Hampshire's largest waterfall
